alert.note: Alert for Mariposa-Madera Lower Sierra; Yosemite NP outside of the valley; Yosemite Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 3:26PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Mariposa and southwestern Tuolumne Counties through 400 PM PDT... At 325 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Yosemite Valley, or 23 miles north of Yosemite South Entrance, moving west at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hetch Hetchy Ranger Station, Miguel Meadow Ranger Station, Tamarack Flat Campground, Porcupine Flat Campground, Lake Eleanor Ranger Station, White Wolf Campground, May Lake High Sierra Camp, Snow Flat, Rancheria Falls Wilderness Campground, Hodgdon Meadow Campground, Hetch Hetchy, Gin Flat, Crane Flat Campground, Yosemite Creek Campground, Crane Flat and Mather Ranger Station. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
